com.tozny.e3db

Class Config

  • Object
    • com.tozny.e3db.Config

  • public class Config
extends Object
    Holds all necessary information to create an E3DB client.

    Use this class to save and load credentials and other information about a given client. The json() method will return a String containing a JSON document that can be later used to re-create the Config object using the fromJson(String) static method.

    Once a Config instance has been created, use the ClientBuilder.fromConfig(Config) method to configure a ClientBuilder that can re-create the client.

    The fromCredentials(ClientCredentials, String) method can also be used create a Config instance, if you do not want to use the built-in JSON document.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      String apiKey
      Username (API key) for the client.
      String apiSecret
      Password (API secret) for the client.
      UUID clientId
      ID of the client.
      String host
      Host the client registered with.
      String name
      Name of the client.
      String privateKey
      Curve25519 private key for the client, as a Base64URL-encoded string.

    • Method Detail

      • fromCredentials

        public static Config fromCredentials(ClientCredentials creds,
                                     String privateKey)
        Create a Config instance from the given credentials and private key.
        Parameters:
        creds - Username (API key), password (API secret), and client ID.
        privateKey - Curve25519 private key, as a Base64URL-encoded string.

      • fromJson

        public static Config fromJson(String doc)
                       throws java.io.IOException
        Create a config instance from the given JSON document.

        The JSON document given in doc must be generated (at some previous time) using the json() method.

        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • json

        public String json()
        Converts this instance to a JSON document.

        The value returned contains a JSON document which can be passed to the fromJson(String) method to re-create this Config instance.
